info.title: Virtual Portfolio API For Digital Portals
info.description:
The virtual portfolio enables the analysis of the current allocation, broken down by asset classes, currencies, 
regions, sectors, style, capitalization, style, maturity, risk, and more.

Relative performance and monthly returns can be measured against benchmarks, using portfolio position transaction (buy/sell) data.
Both the realized profit/loss (resulting from closed transactions) and the potential profit/loss (resulting from positions that have not been sold yet) can be queried.

Portfolio endpoints allow creation and managing a transaction-based portfolio. A transaction-based portfolio contains a gapless history of all transactions to be able to accurately reproduce the investment record of the portfolio.

An instrument added to a portfolio is called a position. Each position consists of multiple buy and sell events called transactions.
Portfolios are limited to 100 positions and 1000 transactions; adding more will result in an error.

A transaction-based portfolio can consist of the following transactions:

* A buy transaction opens or adds to a position in the portfolio, decreasing the cash value by the purchase price at the same time. If there is not enough cash in the portfolio to cover the transaction, the cash value becomes negative.
* A sell transaction decreases or closes a position in the portfolio, increasing the cash value by the sale price at the same time. A sell transaction can only be created if the number of shares of a given position exceeds the number being sold.
* A cash transaction increases or decreases the cash position of the portfolio. A portfolio can have only one cash position. The cash position is tracked automatically as each buy or sell transaction implicitly affects it. The cash position can be negative as a buy transaction does not check whether enough cash is available. The cash position does not generate interest; its performance is always 0%.

The chosen prices and key figures in the endpoints are using the same quality, which is configurable per application. Possible values are delayed (DLY), best (BST), end-of-day (EOD) or realtime (RLT). The default value for the price quality is BST.

The portfolio endpoints use different methods to calculate key figures. All key figures except the risk in /portfolio/detail/list, /portfolio/get, and /portfolio/position/list are calculated on-the-fly with current prices. The risk key figures are calculated on-the-fly with current prices, but the result is cached for 24 hours. The key figures in /portfolio/evaluation/list are calculated on end-of-day basis.

The Virtual Portfolio API for Digital Portals is fully integrated with the corresponding Quotes API, allowing access to detailed price and performance information of instruments in a watchlist. This also supports basic security identifier cross-reference. To complement the Watchlist API and Virtual Portfolio API with direct access to price histories, please refer to the Time Series API for Digital Portals.

post.description:
Create a portfolio.

Certain error conditions yield errors as follows: 

|Error Condition|HTTP Error|
|-------|--------|
|The number of portfolios would exceed 100.|400 Bad Request|
post.summary: Create a portfolio.

data.description: The data member contains the request's primary data.

currency.description: Main currency used as the portfolio's currency. See endpoint /basic/valueUnit/currency/main/list for valid values.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the request.

data.description: Details of the portfolio.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the response.

post.summary: Delete a portfolio.

data.description: The data member contains the request's primary data.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the request.

data.description: This member is always empty.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the response.

parameters.name: _attributes
parameters.description: Limit the attributes returned in the response to the specified set.

data.description: Details of the portfolio.

currency.description: Currency of the portfolio. See endpoint `/basic/valueUnit/currency/main/list` for possible values.

lifecycle.description: Events in the lifecycle of a portfolio.

creation.description: Date and time of the portfolio creation.

transaction.description: Date and time of the portfolio.

first.description: Date and time of the first transaction.

latest.description: Date and time of the most recent transaction.

asOfDate.description: Date and time of the portfolio valuation.

summary.description: Summary of portfolio values in the portfolio's currency (see attribute `currency`).

totalValue.description: The total portfolio value, i.e. the current market value of the portfolio plus cash.

marketValue.description: The current market value of the securities in the portfolio.

purchaseValue.description: The total purchase value of all securities.

numberPositions.description: Number of positions in the portfolio.

number.description: Total number of transactions in the portfolio.

turnover.description: Total turnover generated by all transactions.

number.description: Number of buy transactions in the portfolio.

turnover.description: Total turnover generated by all buy transactions.

number.description: Number of sell transactions in the portfolio.

turnover.description: Total turnover generated by all sell transactions.

profitLoss.description: Profit and loss analysis. Positive values indicate profit; negative values indicate loss. All calculations are performed in the currency of the portfolio.

realized.description: Summary of realized profit or loss resulting from closed positions, i.e. instrument positions that have been sold entirely

absolute.description: Absolute value of profit or loss.

relative.description: Relative value of profit or loss.

potential.description: Summary of potential profit or loss resulting from open positions, i.e. instrument positions that have not been sold.

absolute.description: Absolute value of profit or loss.

relative.description: Relative value of profit or loss.

total.description: Summary of potential profit or loss resulting from open and closed positions.

absolute.description: Absolute value of realized and potential profit or loss.

relative.description: Relative value of realized and potential profit or loss.

today.description: Summary of today's profit or loss, calculated using the most recent price and the last price of the prior trading day.

absolute.description: Absolute value of profit or loss.

relative.description: Relative value of profit or loss.

volatility.description: Portfolio's volatility over the last 250 calendar days.

valueAtRisk.description: Current portfolio value-at-risk, calculated using the variance/covariance method.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the response.

data.description: List of portfolios.

currency.description: Main currency of the portfolio. See endpoint `/basic/valueUnit/currency/main/list` for possible values.

summary.description: Summary of portfolio values in the portfolio's currency (see attribute `currency`).

totalValue.description: The total portfolio value, i.e. the current market value of the portfolio plus cash.

marketValue.description: The current market value of the securities in the portfolio.

numberPositions.description: Number of positions in the portfolio.

number.description: Total number of transactions in the portfolio.

turnover.description: Total turnover generated by all transactions.

profitLoss.description: Profit and loss analysis. Positive values indicate profit; negative values indicate loss. All calculations are performed in the currency of the portfolio.

total.description: Summary of potential profit or loss resulting from open and closed positions.

absolute.description: Absolute value of realized and potential profit or loss.

relative.description: Relative value of realized and potential profit or loss.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the response.

parameters.name: _attributes
parameters.description: Limit the attributes returned in the response to the specified set.
Sortable attributes. The sort order is ascending unless it is prefixed with a minus sign, in which case it is descending. A list of at most 2 (possibly prefixed) attribute name(s) is allowed.

post.description: Performs an evaluation over a period of time and returns portfolio key figures for each day, week, or month.
post.summary: Evaluate a portfolio.

data.description: The data member contains the request's primary data.

start.description: The starting point of the date range (inclusive).

end.description: The ending point of the date range (inclusive).

range.description: Date range for the time series. A valid date range is between 1900-01-01 and the day after the current day. A date before the date of the first transaction is implicitly adjusted to the date of the portfolio's first transaction.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the request.

data.description: List of dates with corresponding key figures.

currency.description: Main currency of the portfolio. See endpoint `/basic/valueUnit/currency/main/list` for possible values.

keyfigures.description: Summary of portfolio key figures in the corresponding resolution.

date.description: Date the evaluation is performed for (end of week or end of month for weekly and monthly resolution respectively).

cash.description: The amount of cash since range start.

totalValue.description: The total portfolio value, i.e. the current market value of the portfolio plus cash.

marketValue.description: The current market value of the securities in the portfolio.

performance.description: The performance of the portfolio since range start.

modifiedDietzPerformance.description: The performance of the portfolio calculated using the "modified Dietz" method since range start.

profitLoss.description: Summary of profit/loss in the corresponding period.

transactions.description: The number of transactions in the corresponding period.

payouts.description: The number of payouts in the corresponding period.

purchaseValue.description: Value of money that has been invested in the corresponding period.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the response.

data.description: List of portfolios.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the response.

parameters.description: Limit the attributes returned in the response to the specified set.
Sortable attributes. The sort order is ascending unless it is prefixed with a minus sign, in which case it is descending. A list of at most 2 (possibly prefixed) attribute name(s) is allowed.

post.description: Add a payout to a portfolio.
post.summary: Add a payout to a portfolio.

data.description: The data member contains the request's primary data.

time.description: Date and time of the payout.

amount.description: Amount of the payout in the portfolio's base currency.

transaction.description: Associates the payout with a sub-position opened by a specific buy transaction. If omitted, the payout will be associated with all sub-positions of the notation in the portfolio.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the request.
The meta member contains the meta information of the response.

data.description: List of open positions.

assetClass.description:
Asset class of the instrument. For possible values see endpoint
`/basic/assetClass/list`.

type.description: Instrument type as defined by FactSet Digital Solutions. Instrument categories are arranged in a hierarchy, with level 1 representing the most coarse granularity and further levels successively refining the granularity (see MDG category system 18).

currency.description: Main currency of the position. See endpoint `/basic/valueUnit/currency/main/list` for possible values.

notation.description: Notation of the transaction establishing the position, i.e. its first transaction.

time.description: Date and time of the trade price

shares.description: Number of shares in the position.

price.description: Weighted average purchase price of the position.

exchangeRate.description: Weighted average exchange rate of the position between the position and portfolio currency.

charges.description: Sum of additional purchase fees for the position in the portfolio's base currency.

value.description: Aggregated purchase value of all buy transactions of the position.

profitLoss.description: Profit and loss of the position. Positive values indicate profit; negative values indicate loss. All calculations are performed in the currency of the portfolio.

intraday.description: Summary of today's profit or loss, calculated using the most recent price and the last price of the prior trading day.

absolute.description: Absolute value of profit or loss.

relative.description: Relative value of profit or loss.

potential.description: Summary of potential profit or loss resulting from open positions, i.e. instrument positions that have not been sold.

absolute.description: Absolute value of profit or loss.

relative.description: Relative value of profit or loss.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the response.

post.description: List all closed positions of a portfolio.
post.summary: List all closed positions of a portfolio.

data.description: The data member contains the request's primary data.

start.description: The starting point of the date range (inclusive).

end.description: The ending point of the date range (inclusive).

range.description: Date range for the closed positions. A valid date range is between 1900-01-01 and the day after the current day. A date before the date of the first transaction is implicitly adjusted to the date of the portfolio's first transaction.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the request.

sort.description: Sortable attributes. The sort order is ascending unless it is prefixed with a minus sign, in which case it is descending. A list of at most 8 (possibly prefixed) attribute name(s) is allowed.

pagination.description: Pagination attributes for the offset-based pagination strategy.

offset.description: Non-negative number of entries to skip, or 0 (default).

limit.description: Non-negative maximum number of entries to return.

data.description: List of closed positions.

assetClass.description:
Asset class of the instrument. For possible values see endpoint
`/basic/assetClass/list`.

type.description: Instrument type as defined by FactSet Digital Solutions. Instrument categories are arranged in a hierarchy, with level 1 representing the most coarse granularity and further levels successively refining the granularity (see MDG category system 18).

transaction.description: Opening and closing transaction of the closed position.

buy.description: Opening transaction of the closed position.

time.description: Date and time of the opening transaction.

currency.description: Currency of the opening transaction. See endpoint `/basic/valueUnit/currency/main/list` for possible values.

price.description: Purchase price of the position in the portfolio's base currency.

charges.description: Charges accrued in the portfolio's base currency.

value.description: Purchase value of the position in the portfolio's base currency.

exchangeRate.description: The exchange rate between the notation's currency and the portfolio currency at the time of the opening trade.

time.description: Date and time of the closing transaction.

currency.description: Currency of the closing transaction. See endpoint `/basic/valueUnit/currency/main/list` for possible values.

price.description: Selling price of the position in the portfolio's base currency.

charges.description: Charges accrued in the portfolio's base currency.

value.description: Sales value of the position in the portfolio's base currency.

exchangeRate.description: The exchange rate between the notation's currency and the portfolio currency at the time of the closing trade.

shares.description: Number of shares in the closed position.

payout.description: Amount of money received from payouts in the portfolio's base currency.

profitLoss.description: Profit and loss of the position. Positive values indicate profit; negative values indicate loss. All calculations are performed in the currency of the portfolio.

absolute.description: Absolute value of profit or loss.

relative.description: Relative value of profit or loss.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the response.

parentTransaction.description: Parent transactions can be used to link transactions together. Only sell or cover short sell can be have buy transaction as its parent. All other combinations will be ignored, but they will not affect the current create request.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the request.

data.description: This member is always emtpy.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the response.

ErrorObject.description: The errors member contains additional information about a failed request.

details.description: A human-readable, unstructured explanation specific to this occurrence of the failure.

encryptedDetails.description: Base64-encoded, internal details about the error, in addition to "details".

type.description: Internal error type of the Foundation API protocol.

attribute.description: For a validation error, a reference to the request parameter that failed validation; otherwise, an empty array.

name.description: Element of the path denoting the request parameter.

index.description: If the attribute "name" designates an array, index of the array element; otherwise the special value -1.

AttributesMember.description: Limit the attributes returned in the response to the specified set.

code.description: The HTTP status code of the response, mirroring the code from the Status-Line of the HTTP response message (see [RFC2616] section 6.1).

StatusObject.description: The status member contains the status code of the response.

CursorBasedPaginationOutputObject.description: Pagination attributes for the cursor-based pagination strategy.

total.description: Total number of entries in the result set.

isEstimatedTotal.description: Flag indicating that the value of `total` is estimated.

next.description: The next cursor position to use in the parameter `pagination.cursor` for an endpoint that supports cursor-based pagination, otherwise `null`.

previous.description: The previous cursor position to use in the parameter `pagination.cursor` for an endpoint that supports cursor-based pagination. If a previous cursor position is not supported or available, `previous` is `null`.

CursorBasedPaginationOutputObjectWithout.description: Pagination attributes for the cursor-based pagination strategy; a total element count is not supported.

next.description: The next cursor position to use in the parameter `pagination.cursor` for an endpoint that supports cursor-based pagination, otherwise `null`.

previous.description: The previous cursor position to use in the parameter `pagination.cursor` for an endpoint that supports cursor-based pagination. If a previous cursor position is not supported or available, `previous` is `null`.

OffsetBasedPaginationOutputObject.description: Pagination attributes for the offset-based pagination strategy.

total.description: Total number of entries in the result set.

isEstimatedTotal.description: Flag indicating that the value of "total" is estimated.

OffsetBasedPaginationOutputObjectWithout.description: Pagination attributes for the offset-based pagination strategy; a total element count is not supported.

hasNext.description: Flag indicating that a subsequent request with the same parameters, except that the parameter `pagination.offset` is incremented by `pagination.limit`, would yield additional results.

isPartial.description: Flag indicating that the response is a possibly incomplete array or an object containing a possibly incomplete array, due to hitting a processing time limit. If `true`, some matching results might be missing from the array, or elements for matching results might be incorrectly included (for example, when priority sorting would have removed the element). Depending on the use case, such a response may be unsuitable.

PartialOutputObject.description: Object denoting that the endpoint response is possibly incomplete.

ErrorResponse.description: Generic error response for all errors (400 ... 599 error codes)
